intro: Actinoschoenus, commonly known as the star grass or star sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance and often grows in wet or marshy environments. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are usually green or brown in color. Actinoschoenus species are often found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types. These plants play an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
